meanings.sent1: She eeches loudly when she sees a spider in the house.
meanings.sent2: He always eeches at the sight of spoiled food.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave a little eech before walking away from the strange object.
meanings.sent4: The smell was so bad that it made her eech involuntarily.
meanings.sent5: The eeching noise from the baby signaled it was time for a diaper change.

meanings.definition: A sound of disgust or annoyance.
meanings.sent1: The eech from the audience showed their disapproval of the performance.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't help but let out an eech when she saw the mess in the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The loud eech from the toddler made everyone in the room chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The eech of the brakes signaled the car coming to a sudden stop.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence was broken by a sudden eech from the back of the room.
